name: proxy-server-aws
description: A proxy server that works on AWS lambda

scripts.test: cross-env NODE_ENV=test npx mocha --require ts-node/register src/**/*.test.ts
scripts.deploy: FUNCTION_NAME=$npm_config_name && FUNCTION_ROLE=$npm_config_role && REGION=$npm_config_region && aws lambda create-function --function-name $FUNCTION_NAME --runtime 'nodejs16.x' --role $FUNCTION_ROLE --zip-file 'fileb://dist/index.zip' --handler index.handler --region $REGION  --output text && aws lambda create-function-url-config --function-name $FUNCTION_NAME --auth-type NONE --cors '{"AllowOrigins":["*"], "AllowHeaders": ["*"], "AllowMethods": ["*"]}' --region $REGION && aws lambda add-permission --function-name $FUNCTION_NAME --action lambda:invokeFunctionUrl --principal "*" --output text --statement-id sample0-statement --region $REGION --function-url-auth-type NONE && echo "The function has been deployed successfully: The function url: " && aws lambda get-function-url-config --function-name $FUNCTION_NAME --region $REGION --query FunctionUrl --output text

author: Ifedayo Karim
